tutorial.title: Blog Post Publishing Page
tutorial.descriptionContent: Code a blog publishing webpage to practice your skills on links and buttons

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use links and buttons to mock up a blog post publishing page.

Let's begin building out our `index.html` page. You can ignore the `today.html` page for now; we'll come back to that one later.  To get started, let's add a heading to define our first content area.

1. Code a second-level heading that contains the text `Select Tags`.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's add a few buttons. The idea is that users use these buttons to "tag" their posts with keywords, which makes it easier for other users to search and find posts.

1. Below the heading, add a button containing the text `Cats` as the first tag option.
2. Add a button containing the text `Code` as the second tag option.
3. Emphasize the text within the `Code` button.
4. Finally, add a third button containing the text `French`.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
We create buttons using the `<button></button>` tags. 

We emphasize text by surrounding it with `<em>` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's create some separation between the buttons you just created and a few more tag buttons you will build in the next step. 1. Add a `
` tag below the last button you just coded.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add two more buttons to our tag buttons section. Add these buttons below the break you just added.

1. Add a button with emphasized text displaying `Code Press`.
2. Create another button with emphasized text displaying `Learn to code`.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

executableContent.instructions:
Finally, we need a button that allows users to save their post. 

1. Create a button with the text `Save Draft` above our `Select Tags` heading.
2. Make the text within the button important using a `strong` element.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we've created our buttons, let's start building out the rest of the page content. 

1. Create a first-level heading that contains the text `CodePress` just after the opening `<body>` tag.

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Remember, first level headings are created using `

` tags.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add some links below our new heading to finish building out the page structure.

1. Create a link displaying `Code 101`. Then, set its `href` attribute to `""`.
2. Create a similar link with the text `Journal`.
3. Create a third link with the text `Today's Top Posts`.
4. Set the third link's `href` to target the second html page we have on our site using the link `today.html`.

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
CodePress

Code 101 Journal Today's Top Posts

Select Tags

files.name: today.html
files.content:
Today's Top Posts

  1. Ordering the club sandwich when you aren't a member
  2. Three easy ways to save (more) money
  3. My best friend is an actual squirrel
  4. What happens to a hotdog encased in epoxy after 1 year?
  5. My favorite season is...
Read More >>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Hyperlinks are created using `` tags. All `` tags require the `href` attribute to define the location that the link sends the visitor upon clicking. Do not use a `/` before the value of the `href` attributes.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's mock up a blog post to simulate this page in use. 1. Add a `
` below the last navigation link. 2. Now add an image with a `src` attribute below the line break. Feel free to use an image from the web or use our example `https://mimo.app/i/coffee.png`. 3. Create a paragraph with some text below the image.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
CodePress

Code 101 Journal Today's Top Posts

Select Tags
files.solvedContent:
CodePress

Code 101 Journal Today's Top Posts

Sit back relax, grab a mug of cold press coffee and enjoy the ride.

Select Tags

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: We can add pictures to webpages by creating images. To create an image, use `` and add the source of that image using the `src` attribute. `` You'll need to use an absolute link to the image, which is simply the full web address of the image.
